info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 13 at 4:20PM CDT until July 13 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS St Louis MO
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Illinois, including the following counties, in south central Illinois, southwestern Clinton and western Washington. In southwest Illinois, eastern Saint Clair.
* WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 420 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with very localized areas of up to 3 inches. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... O'Fallon, Shiloh, Mascoutah, Lebanon, Freeburg, New Baden, Scott AFB, Trenton, New Athens, Marissa, Aviston, Okawville, Albers, Lively Grove, New Memphis, St. Libory, Lenzburg, Johannisburg, Damiansville and Summerfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Clinton, IL; St. Clair, IL; Washington, IL
